zim.inc package¶

Submodules¶

zim.inc.arithmetic module¶

arithmetic is a Python module that allows mixing arithmetic operations and text.

Usage as command:

arithmetic expression(s) Evaluate expression(s). arithmetic -f path Read path contents and evaluate. arithmetic Read from standard input and evaluate. arithmetic -h Show usage

Examples:

$ arithmetic 2 x 3 6 $ echo 4 x 12 | arithmetic 48 $ echo ‘a = 5 a + 4 =’ | arithmetic a = 5 a + 4 = 9 $ arithmetic < filename …

Usage as module:

from arithmetic import feed … resultText = feed( inputText ) …

zim.inc.arithmetic.AddCommas(s)¶

‘Return s with thousands separators.

Handles sign, decimals and thousands separator.

class zim.inc.arithmetic.Lexer(text)¶

Bases: object

gettoken()¶

Get next token from text and return its type and value.

Return (None,None) if no more text.

Identifiers letter ( letter | digit | _ )* Numbers digit ( digit | , | . ) * Operators - + * / ^ ** x

x can be a name or an operator

x preceded and followed by a digit is taken as if preceded and followed by a space. i.e 5x3 is seen as 5 x 3.

zim.inc.arithmetic.TypeAndValueOf(expression)¶

“Returns a (type, value) tuple.

type may be:

v = void i = integer, f = float e = expression containing variables a = arithmetic expression, no variables n = name

value is expression with some modifications: blank spaces and commas removed, x replaced by *.

zim.inc.arithmetic.evaluate(expression_text, UseDigitGrouping=True, variables={}, functions={})¶

Parse expression, calculate and return its result.

if UseDigitGrouping is True, the result includes commas.

zim.inc.arithmetic.feed(text)¶

Feed text to the parser. It is processed line by line.

zim.inc.arithmetic.safe_eval(expression)¶

Safe evaluation of a python expression

Module contents¶

This package contains third party libraries to be packaged with zim. See the respective files for the copyright and license notices.
